newsitem.title: USA: D&P may downgrade First Merchants debt.
newsitem.headline: D&P may downgrade First Merchants debt.

text.p: Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co said Thursday it may downgrade the credit rating of First Merchants Acceptance Corp's $51.75 million of subordinated debt due 2006.
The action reflects First Merchants announcement that it may seek protection under the U.S. bankruptcy code, D&P said in a news release.
The subordinated notes are currently rated single-B.

First Merchants, a nonprime lender, has been unable to negotiate funding to replace its secured senior loan agreement with its banks which expired June 30, 1997. The bank group has ceased providing funding, D&P said.
Unless First Merchants is successful in its efforts to obtain other sources of financing, it may be forced to seek bankruptcy protection, D&P said.
